name: Guidelines Agent Basic Functionality Tests
description: Unit tests for Guidelines agent covering Cyoda development best practices

parts.text: What are the core design principles for Cyoda applications?

The core Cyoda design principles are: 1) No reflection - use common module patterns instead, 2) Use common module for shared code, 3) Thin routes - routes should be proxies to EntityService with no business logic, 4) Prefer technical IDs over business identifiers, 5) Use manual transitions only for entity updates, 6) Entity state is workflow-managed and read-only.
How should I organize entity files in a Cyoda project?

Entity files should be organized in versioned directories following this pattern: entity/example_entity/version_1/example_entity.py. Use Pydantic V2 models with @field_validator decorators. Define ENTITY_NAME and ENTITY_VERSION constants. Workflow files should use snake_case naming and entity names must match exactly (case-sensitive) between entity definitions and workflow files.
What testing tools should I run before committing Cyoda code?

Before committing Cyoda code, you should run: mypy for type checking, flake8 for linting, black for code formatting, isort for import sorting, and bandit for security checks. Also ensure comprehensive test coverage with pytest, testing both success and failure scenarios with descriptive test names.
